005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj;
006
007import static edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.util.ErrorMessages.requireNonNullParam;
008
009import edu.wpi.first.hal.FRCNetComm.tResourceType;
010import edu.wpi.first.hal.HAL;
011import edu.wpi.first.networktables.MultiSubscriber;
012import edu.wpi.first.networktables.NetworkTable;
013import edu.wpi.first.networktables.NetworkTableEntry;
014import edu.wpi.first.networktables.NetworkTableInstance;
015import edu.wpi.first.networktables.StringPublisher;
016import edu.wpi.first.networktables.TopicListener;
017import edu.wpi.first.networktables.TopicListenerFlags;
018import java.util.Collection;
019
020/**
021 * The preferences class provides a relatively simple way to save important values to the roboRIO to
022 * access the next time the roboRIO is booted.
023 *
024 * <p>This class loads and saves from a file inside the roboRIO. The user can not access the file
025 * directly, but may modify values at specific fields which will then be automatically saved to the
026 * file by the NetworkTables server.
027 *
028 * <p>This class is thread safe.
029 *
030 * <p>This will also interact with {@link NetworkTable} by creating a table called "Preferences"
031 * with all the key-value pairs.
032 */
033public final class Preferences {
034  /** The Preferences table name. */
035  private static final String TABLE_NAME = "Preferences";
036  /** The network table. */
037  private static NetworkTable m_table;
038
039  private static StringPublisher m_typePublisher;
040  private static MultiSubscriber m_tableSubscriber;
041  private static TopicListener m_listener;
042
043  /** Creates a preference class. */
044  private Preferences() {}
045
046  static {
047    setNetworkTableInstance(NetworkTableInstance.getDefault());
048    HAL.report(tResourceType.kResourceType_Preferences, 0);
049  }
050
051  /**
052   * Set the NetworkTable instance used for entries. For testing purposes; use with caution.
053   *
054   * @param inst NetworkTable instance
055   */
056  public static synchronized void setNetworkTableInstance(NetworkTableInstance inst) {
057    m_table = inst.getTable(TABLE_NAME);
058    if (m_typePublisher != null) {
059      m_typePublisher.close();
060    }
061    m_typePublisher = m_table.getStringTopic(".type").publish();
062    m_typePublisher.set("RobotPreferences");
063
064    // Subscribe to all Preferences; this ensures we get the latest values
065    // ahead of a getter call.
066    if (m_tableSubscriber != null) {
067      m_tableSubscriber.close();
068    }
069    m_tableSubscriber = new MultiSubscriber(inst, new String[] {m_table.getPath() + "/"});
070
071    // Listener to set all Preferences values to persistent
072    // (for backwards compatibility with old dashboards).
073    if (m_listener != null) {
074      m_listener.close();
075    }
076    m_listener =
077        new TopicListener(
078            m_table.getInstance(),
079            new String[] {m_table.getPath() + "/"},
080            TopicListenerFlags.kImmediate | TopicListenerFlags.kPublish,
081            event -> event.info.getTopic().setPersistent(true));
082  }
083
084  /**
085   * Gets the preferences keys.
086   *
087   * @return a collection of the keys
088   */
089  public static Collection<String> getKeys() {
090    return m_table.getKeys();
091  }
092
093  /**
094   * Puts the given string into the preferences table.
095   *
096   * @param key the key
097   * @param value the value
098   * @throws NullPointerException if value is null
099   */
100  public static void setString(String key, String value) {
101    requireNonNullParam(value, "value", "setString");
102
103    NetworkTableEntry entry = m_table.getEntry(key);
104    entry.setString(value);
105    entry.setPersistent();
106  }
107
108  /**
109   * Puts the given string into the preferences table if it doesn't already exist.
110   *
111   * @param key The key
112   * @param value The value
113   */
114  public static void initString(String key, String value) {
115    NetworkTableEntry entry = m_table.getEntry(key);
116    entry.setDefaultString(value);
117    entry.setPersistent();
118  }
119
120  /**
121   * Puts the given int into the preferences table.
122   *
123   * @param key the key
124   * @param value the value
125   */
126  public static void setInt(String key, int value) {
127    NetworkTableEntry entry = m_table.getEntry(key);
128    entry.setDouble(value);
129    entry.setPersistent();
130  }
131
132  /**
133   * Puts the given int into the preferences table if it doesn't already exist.
134   *
135   * @param key The key
136   * @param value The value
137   */
138  public static void initInt(String key, int value) {
139    NetworkTableEntry entry = m_table.getEntry(key);
140    entry.setDefaultDouble(value);
141    entry.setPersistent();
142  }
143
144  /**
145   * Puts the given double into the preferences table.
146   *
147   * @param key the key
148   * @param value the value
149   */
150  public static void setDouble(String key, double value) {
151    NetworkTableEntry entry = m_table.getEntry(key);
152    entry.setDouble(value);
153    entry.setPersistent();
154  }
155
156  /**
157   * Puts the given double into the preferences table if it doesn't already exist.
158   *
159   * @param key The key
160   * @param value The value
161   */
162  public static void initDouble(String key, double value) {
163    NetworkTableEntry entry = m_table.getEntry(key);
164    entry.setDefaultDouble(value);
165    entry.setPersistent();
166  }
167
168  /**
169   * Puts the given float into the preferences table.
170   *
171   * @param key the key
172   * @param value the value
173   */
174  public static void setFloat(String key, float value) {
175    NetworkTableEntry entry = m_table.getEntry(key);
176    entry.setDouble(value);
177    entry.setPersistent();
178  }
179
180  /**
181   * Puts the given float into the preferences table if it doesn't already exist.
182   *
183   * @param key The key
184   * @param value The value
185   */
186  public static void initFloat(String key, float value) {
187    NetworkTableEntry entry = m_table.getEntry(key);
188    entry.setDefaultDouble(value);
189    entry.setPersistent();
190  }
191
192  /**
193   * Puts the given boolean into the preferences table.
194   *
195   * @param key the key
196   * @param value the value
197   */
198  public static void setBoolean(String key, boolean value) {
199    NetworkTableEntry entry = m_table.getEntry(key);
200    entry.setBoolean(value);
201    entry.setPersistent();
202  }
203
204  /**
205   * Puts the given boolean into the preferences table if it doesn't already exist.
206   *
207   * @param key The key
208   * @param value The value
209   */
210  public static void initBoolean(String key, boolean value) {
211    NetworkTableEntry entry = m_table.getEntry(key);
212    entry.setDefaultBoolean(value);
213    entry.setPersistent();
214  }
215
216  /**
217   * Puts the given long into the preferences table.
218   *
219   * @param key the key
220   * @param value the value
221   */
222  public static void setLong(String key, long value) {
223    NetworkTableEntry entry = m_table.getEntry(key);
224    entry.setDouble(value);
225    entry.setPersistent();
226  }
227
228  /**
229   * Puts the given long into the preferences table if it doesn't already exist.
230   *
231   * @param key The key
232   * @param value The value
233   */
234  public static void initLong(String key, long value) {
235    NetworkTableEntry entry = m_table.getEntry(key);
236    entry.setDefaultDouble(value);
237    entry.setPersistent();
238  }
239
240  /**
241   * Returns whether or not there is a key with the given name.
242   *
243   * @param key the key
244   * @return if there is a value at the given key
245   */
246  public static boolean containsKey(String key) {
247    return m_table.containsKey(key);
248  }
249
250  /**
251   * Remove a preference.
252   *
253   * @param key the key
254   */
255  public static void remove(String key) {
256    NetworkTableEntry entry = m_table.getEntry(key);
257    entry.clearPersistent();
258    entry.unpublish();
259  }
260
261  /** Remove all preferences. */
262  public static void removeAll() {
263    for (String key : m_table.getKeys()) {
264      if (!".type".equals(key)) {
265        remove(key);
266      }
267    }
268  }
269
270  /**
271   * Returns the string at the given key. If this table does not have a value for that position,
272   * then the given backup value will be returned.
273   *
274   * @param key the key
275   * @param backup the value to return if none exists in the table
276   * @return either the value in the table, or the backup
277   */
278  public static String getString(String key, String backup) {
279    return m_table.getEntry(key).getString(backup);
280  }
281
282  /**
283   * Returns the int at the given key. If this table does not have a value for that position, then
284   * the given backup value will be returned.
285   *
286   * @param key the key
287   * @param backup the value to return if none exists in the table
288   * @return either the value in the table, or the backup
289   */
290  public static int getInt(String key, int backup) {
291    return (int) m_table.getEntry(key).getDouble(backup);
292  }
293
294  /**
295   * Returns the double at the given key. If this table does not have a value for that position,
296   * then the given backup value will be returned.
297   *
298   * @param key the key
299   * @param backup the value to return if none exists in the table
300   * @return either the value in the table, or the backup
301   */
302  public static double getDouble(String key, double backup) {
303    return m_table.getEntry(key).getDouble(backup);
304  }
305
306  /**
307   * Returns the boolean at the given key. If this table does not have a value for that position,
308   * then the given backup value will be returned.
309   *
310   * @param key the key
311   * @param backup the value to return if none exists in the table
312   * @return either the value in the table, or the backup
313   */
314  public static boolean getBoolean(String key, boolean backup) {
315    return m_table.getEntry(key).getBoolean(backup);
316  }
317
318  /**
319   * Returns the float at the given key. If this table does not have a value for that position, then
320   * the given backup value will be returned.
321   *
322   * @param key the key
323   * @param backup the value to return if none exists in the table
324   * @return either the value in the table, or the backup
325   */
326  public static float getFloat(String key, float backup) {
327    return (float) m_table.getEntry(key).getDouble(backup);
328  }
329
330  /**
331   * Returns the long at the given key. If this table does not have a value for that position, then
332   * the given backup value will be returned.
333   *
334   * @param key the key
335   * @param backup the value to return if none exists in the table
336   * @return either the value in the table, or the backup
337   */
338  public static long getLong(String key, long backup) {
339    return (long) m_table.getEntry(key).getDouble(backup);
340  }
341}
